description.en: Process diagrams typically use passive voice because the focus is on the action, not who does it.
description.vi: Quy trình thường dùng câu bị động vì trọng tâm là hành động, không phải người thực hiện.

structures.name: Basic Passive
structures.example: The corn is ground by the machine.
structures.note: Use present tense for general/natural processes

structures.name: Complex Passive
structures.formula: Once/After + Object + has been + Past Participle, it is + Past Participle
structures.example: Once the corn has been ground, it is packed into bags.
structures.note: Shows completed step before next step begins

structures.name: Passive with Modal
structures.formula: Object + can be/must be + Past Participle
structures.example: The mixture can be heated for 30 minutes.

commonVerbs.example: The product is transported to the factory.
The data is processed by computer.
The water is filtered through sand.
The product is dried in the sun.
The goods are packaged for shipping.
The final product is stored in warehouses.

beginning.example: The process begins with the collection of raw materials.
Initially, water is pumped from the reservoir.
In the first stage, ingredients are gathered.
At the outset, materials are inspected.
First of all, the raw materials are cleaned.

middle.example: Following this, the product is cooled.
The next step involves filtering the liquid.
After that, it is left to dry.
At this stage, quality checks are conducted.
Once this is done, the material is shaped.
Having been processed, the product moves to packaging.

end.example: Finally, the goods are shipped to retailers.
The process culminates in the sale of products.
The final output is packaged food products.

end.phrase: At the end of the process
end.example: At the end of the process, waste is recycled.
Ultimately, the finished goods reach consumers.

cyclical.example: The cycle then repeats from the beginning.
The water is channeled back to the reservoir.
The process returns to the start.

overviewPhrases: The diagram illustrates the process of [noun phrase].
The diagram shows how [noun] is produced/made/manufactured.
Overall, there are [number] main stages in the process.
The process consists of [number] distinct stages, beginning with [X] and ending with [Y].
It is a cyclical/linear process involving [number] key steps.
